This morning, the High People's Court in
Hanoi held an appeal hearing in the
rescue flight case to consider the
appeal of 21 defendants. The trial took
place over 4 days by judge May Anh Tai Chanh.
21/54 defendants of the rescue flight trial
filed an appeal against the first instance verdict.
In which, some people asked for a reduced
sentence. Of the 21 defendants who appealed, four
people were sentenced to life in prison.  The
remaining defendant received a prison sentence of 3 to 16 years in
prison. Notably, defendant Hoang Van Hung, a
former investigator who was sentenced to life in prison by the First Instance Court
for fraudulent
appropriation of property, asked to change the content of
his appeal.  The defendant
accused his

Field investigation investigating a fire at a
textile and dyeing company
earlier than midnight on December 25, a
fire suddenly broke out in a
foreign-invested textile and dyeing company located
on Nguyen Du Street, An Phu Thanh Ward.
Thuan An street was accompanied by many explosions. The
fire area was a boiler oil tank used to
dye the prize. Receiving the news,
Binh Duong province's fire prevention and fighting police sent 10
water trucks and more than 60 officers and soldiers to the
fire scene.  Preventing the fire from spreading
through the company's warehouses,
nearly 1 hour later the
fire was controlled, causing no loss of life,
but the company's boiler area was damaged and the
entire electrical system was also affected.
On the morning of December 25, the enterprise
gave factory workers a break from work to
fix the problem. At the same time, serving the
field examination of the cause of the
fire being investigated by the authorities
